comments:
Problem:
========
We are trying to launch as many as GDBs to debug our special programs. We got an exception when we are trying to launch about 100 gdbs. Please refer to the following fragment from the .log. The following .log is for WinXP. For Linux, we believe there may also some limit, but it is larger than WinXP.

The question is : 
 - Is there a limitation about how many processes the Spawner class can create?
 - or is there anything I did wrong?

Thanks.

Fragment from .log:
==================

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.cdt.debug.mi.core 4 150 2006-03-22 17:51:07.817
!MESSAGE Exec error:Too many processes
!STACK 0
java.io.IOException: Exec error:Too many processes
        at org.eclipse.cdt.utils.spawner.Spawner.exec(Spawner.java:243)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.utils.spawner.Spawner.<init>(Spawner.java:57)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.utils.spawner.Spawner.<init>(Spawner.java:85)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.utils.spawner.Spawner.<init>(Spawner.java:77)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.utils.spawner.ProcessFactory.exec(ProcessFactory.java:59)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.debug.mi.core.MIProcessAdapter.getGDBProcess(MIProcessAdapter.java:49)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.debug.mi.core.MIProcessAdapter.<init>(MIProcessAdapter.java:37)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.debug.mi.core.MIPlugin.createCSession(MIPlugin.java:325)
        at mytools.TestDebugger.createLaunchSession(TestDebugger.java:50)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.debug.mi.core.GDBCDIDebugger.createDebuggerSession(GDBCDIDebugger.java:73)
        at mytools.TestLaunchDelegate.launch(TestLaunchDelegate.java:35)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:590)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:152)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:737)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:931)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)
Yes, there is a limitation in the native code (org.eclipse.cdt.core.win32\library\Win32ProcessEx.c). If you need a quick fix, just change the value of MAX_PROCS and rebuild the DLL.
